answers.answer: I think some blood tests might be a good idea, this could be anaemia.Some of the symptoms could be hormonal or menopausal, I'd suggest seeing the doctor and getting some blood tests done.Good luck

Hard to tell what is going on with your mom it could be anemia or diabetes. If you blood sugar gets too far off it can make  you dizzzy, tired, thirsty and perhaps have headaches. I don't know what the fissures are in this case. In any case you should get her in to the doctor and get a fasting blood sugar, with a chemistry profile and a complete blood count. The doctor may find something else but it is a good start.good luck and I hope she gets better soon! Let us know what happens.mkh9

I agree with the answers above.  She definitely needs to get some blood tests done.  My mom was having some of the same symptoms and they had to do some transfusions.  A few years ago they found she had a very bad bleeding ulcer and a mass in her abdomen.  The mass was benign but was causing some of the bleeding.  She has been good since surgery.  Anything unexplained should always be checked out.
